title: Oscars 2025: The Ultimate Party Guide With Beyoncé, Jay-Z, Madonna, Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande and More
description: Happy Oscars Week! As Los Angeles gets ready for Hollywood’s biggest night of the year, here’s Variety’s ultimate party guide for all things happening before, during and after the 97th Academy Awards on March 2. From Diane Von Furstenberg’s luncheon for women in film to Madonna and Guy Oseary’s annual late-night bash, as well as […]
author: Marcmalkin
excerpt: Look at Variety's ultimate party guide for Oscars 2025 to find out what's going on before, during and after this year's Academy Awards.
text: Happy Oscars Week! As Los Angeles gets ready for Hollywood’s biggest night of the year, here’s Variety’s ultimate party guide for all things happening before, during and after the 97th Academy Awards on March 2. From Diane Von Furstenberg’s luncheon for women in film to Madonna and Guy Oseary’s annual late-night bash, as well as Jay-Z and Beyoncé’s Gold Party, red carpets are being rolled out all over town. Tuesday, Feb. 25 Oscars Nominees Dinner Event replaces the annual nominees luncheon, which was canceled due to the wildfires. Popular on Variety Academy Museum, Los Angeles 6 p.m. Time Women of the Year Honorees include Nicole Kidman, Anna Sawai, A’ja Wilson, Olivia Munn, Jordan Chiles and more. Performance by Laufey. The West Hollywood Edition, West Hollywood 6 p.m. Wednesday, Feb. 26 Lumen Awards Honoring John Ridley, Lucy Walker, Avery Colvert, John Wells, Gregory Nava and Dolores Huerta and Participant. Hotel Casa Del Mar, Santa Monica 10 a.m.-1 p.m. Diane Von Furstenberg Nominee Luncheon Hosted by Diane Von Furstenberg, Ava DuVernay, Donn Langley and Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, celebrates women in film and female Oscar nominees Private residence, Beverly Hills Universal Pictures, Focus Features and Dreamworks Animation Studios celebrate their Oscar nominees. Steak 48, Beverly Hills7 p.m. South Asians at the Oscars Hosted by Mindy Kaling, Bela Bajaria, Liza Koshy, Aasif Mandvi, Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, Nik Dodani, Pawo Chowning Dorji, Shruti Ganguly, Anita Chatterjee and Shamina Singh. Carondelet House, Los Angeles 6-9 p.m. Vanities: A Night For Young Hollywood Hosted by Vanity Fair and Instagram along with Monica Barbaro, Keke Palmer, Aaron Pierre and Anna Sawai. Cocktails by Tequila Don Julio. Bar Marmont, West Hollywood Thursday, Feb. 27 Essence Black Women in Hollywood Honoring Cynthia Erivo, Teyana Taylor, Marla Gibbs and Raamla Mohamed. Fairmont Century Plaza Hotel, Century City 1 p.m. Angel Art Benefit art auction for Project Angel Food, hosted by Alexandra Grant. Bonhams, Los Angeles 6 p.m. Oscar Wilde Awards Honoring John C. Reilly, Éanna Hardwicke, Kathleen Kennedy and Frank Marshall.  US-Ireland Alliance hosts. The Ebell of Los Angeles 7:30-11 p.m. Macro Pre-Oscars Party Seventh annual event. Private location, Los Angeles Friday, Feb. 28 Women in Film WIF hosts 18th annual nominees celebration. Wheelhouse,  West Hollywood 6-8:30 p.m. CAA Living Room, Los Angeles 9 p.m.-1 a.m. Vanity Fair/Saint Laurent Dinner VF editor-in-chief Radhika Jones and Saint Laurent creative director Anthony Vaccarello host. Private location Female Trailblazers On and Off the Court Hosted by the Women’s Tennis Association and tennis champion Aryna Sabalenka, Ava DuVernary and WTA Ventures CEO Marina Storti. Sunset Tower Hotel, West Hollywood 4-6 p.m. Saturday, March 1 Verve Animation Brunch Dama, Los Angeles 11:30 a.m.-2:30 p.m. Netflix Oscar Nominee Celebration Sunset Tower Hotel, West Hollywood 5-7 p.m. (Remarks delivered at 5:45 p.m.) Giorgio Armani Giorgio Armani, Beverly Hills 5-7 p.m. Charles Finch and Chanel Dinner Polo Lounge at the Beverly Hills Hotel, Beverly Hills 7:30 p.m. The Night Before 23rd annual MPTF fundraiser, with honorary chairs Demi Moore and Colman Domingo. Private location 8 p.m. Jim Rygiel and Stephen Castor’s Pre-Oscar Party Celebrating this year’s nominees while also honoring the significant contributions of Chinese filmmakers and actors to the global film industry and the box office success of “Ne Zha 2.” Private residence, Beverly Hills 8 p.m. Sunday, March 2 97th Academy Awards Hosted by Conan O’Brien with performances by Arian Grande, Cynthia Erivo, Blackpink’s Lisa, Queen Latifah. Raye and Doja Cat. Appearance by the Los Angeles Master Chorale. Dolby Theatre, Hollywood 7 p.m. Elton John AIDS Foundation Academy Awards Viewing Party Hosted by Elton John, David Furnish, Jean Smart, Sheryl Lee Ralph and Neil Patrick Harris and David Burtka. Performance by Chappell Roan. West Hollywood Park, West Hollywood Alta Global Media Viewing Party Los Angeles Athletic Club, Los Angeles 3-7:30 p.m. Neon Viewing Party Sunset Tower Hotel, West Hollywood Governors Ball The Academy’s official after-party. Menu by Wolfgang Puck Catering with drinks by Tequila Don Julio, Clarendelle & Domaine Clarence Dillon wines and Champagne Lallier. Ray Dolby Ballroom at Ovation Hollywood, Hollywood Immediately following the Oscars broadcastSearchlight Pictures Celebrating nominees from “A Complete Unknown and “A Real Pain.” Cipriani, Beverly Hills 7:30 p.m. Vanity Fair Hosted by VF editor-in-chief Radhika Jones. Music by DJ Tay James and DJ Politik in the Tequila Don Julio Music Room. Wallis Annenberg Center for the Performing Arts, Beverly Hills 8 p.m. Netflix Chateau Marmont, West Hollywood Immediately after the Oscar ceremony. The Party Madonna and Guy Oseary host their 17th annual soirée. Sponsored by Gucci, Capital One and Salesforce. Specialty drinks by Starbucks. Private residence 10 p.m. Gold Party VIP late-night after-party hosted by Jay-Z and Beyoncé. Chateau Marmont, West Hollywood 11 p.m.
html:
Happy Oscars Week!

As Los Angeles gets ready for Hollywood’s biggest night of the year, here’s Variety’s ultimate party guide for all things happening before, during and after the 97th Academy Awards on March 2.

From Diane Von Furstenberg’s luncheon for women in film to Madonna and Guy Oseary’s annual late-night bash, as well as Jay-Z and Beyoncé’s Gold Party, red carpets are being rolled out all over town.

Tuesday, Feb. 25

Oscars Nominees Dinner

Event replaces the annual nominees luncheon, which was canceled due to the wildfires.

Popular on Variety

Academy Museum, Los Angeles

6 p.m.

Time Women of the Year

Honorees include Nicole Kidman, Anna Sawai, A’ja Wilson, Olivia Munn, Jordan Chiles and more. Performance by Laufey.

The West Hollywood Edition, West Hollywood

6 p.m.

Wednesday, Feb. 26

Lumen Awards

Honoring John Ridley, Lucy Walker, Avery Colvert, John Wells, Gregory Nava and Dolores Huerta and Participant.

Hotel Casa Del Mar, Santa Monica

10 a.m.-1 p.m.

Diane Von Furstenberg Nominee Luncheon

Hosted by Diane Von Furstenberg, Ava DuVernay, Donn Langley and Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, celebrates women in film and female Oscar nominees

Private residence, Beverly Hills

Universal Pictures, Focus Features and Dreamworks Animation

Studios celebrate their Oscar nominees.

Steak 48, Beverly Hills
7 p.m.

South Asians at the Oscars

Hosted by Mindy Kaling, Bela Bajaria, Liza Koshy, Aasif Mandvi, Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, Nik Dodani, Pawo Chowning Dorji, Shruti Ganguly, Anita Chatterjee and Shamina Singh.

Carondelet House, Los Angeles

6-9 p.m.

Vanities: A Night For Young Hollywood

Hosted by Vanity Fair and Instagram along with Monica Barbaro, Keke Palmer, Aaron Pierre and Anna Sawai. Cocktails by Tequila Don Julio.

Bar Marmont, West Hollywood

Thursday, Feb. 27

Essence Black Women in Hollywood

Honoring Cynthia Erivo, Teyana Taylor, Marla Gibbs and Raamla Mohamed.

Fairmont Century Plaza Hotel, Century City

1 p.m.

Angel Art

Benefit art auction for Project Angel Food, hosted by Alexandra Grant.

Bonhams, Los Angeles

6 p.m.

Oscar Wilde Awards

Honoring John C. Reilly, Éanna Hardwicke, Kathleen Kennedy and Frank Marshall.  US-Ireland Alliance hosts.

The Ebell of Los Angeles

7:30-11 p.m.

Macro Pre-Oscars Party

Seventh annual event.

Private location, Los Angeles

Friday, Feb. 28

Women in Film

WIF hosts 18th annual nominees celebration.

Wheelhouse,  West Hollywood

6-8:30 p.m.

CAA

Living Room, Los Angeles

9 p.m.-1 a.m.

Vanity Fair/Saint Laurent Dinner

VF editor-in-chief Radhika Jones and Saint Laurent creative director Anthony Vaccarello host.

Private location

Female Trailblazers On and Off the Court

Hosted by the Women’s Tennis Association and tennis champion Aryna Sabalenka, Ava DuVernary and WTA Ventures CEO Marina Storti.

Sunset Tower Hotel, West Hollywood

4-6 p.m.

Saturday, March 1

Verve Animation Brunch

Dama, Los Angeles

11:30 a.m.-2:30 p.m.

Netflix Oscar Nominee Celebration

Sunset Tower Hotel, West Hollywood

5-7 p.m. (Remarks delivered at 5:45 p.m.)

Giorgio Armani

Giorgio Armani, Beverly Hills

5-7 p.m.

Charles Finch and Chanel Dinner

Polo Lounge at the Beverly Hills Hotel, Beverly Hills

7:30 p.m.

The Night Before

23rd annual MPTF fundraiser, with honorary chairs Demi Moore and Colman Domingo.

Private location

8 p.m.

Jim Rygiel and Stephen Castor’s Pre-Oscar Party

Celebrating this year’s nominees while also honoring the significant contributions of Chinese filmmakers and actors to the global film industry and the box office success of “Ne Zha 2.”

Private residence, Beverly Hills

8 p.m.

Sunday, March 2

97th Academy Awards

Hosted by Conan O’Brien with performances by Arian Grande, Cynthia Erivo, Blackpink’s Lisa, Queen Latifah. Raye and Doja Cat. Appearance by the Los Angeles Master Chorale.

Dolby Theatre, Hollywood

7 p.m.

Elton John AIDS Foundation Academy Awards Viewing Party

Hosted by Elton John, David Furnish, Jean Smart, Sheryl Lee Ralph and Neil Patrick Harris and David Burtka. Performance by Chappell Roan.

West Hollywood Park, West Hollywood

Alta Global Media Viewing Party

Los Angeles Athletic Club, Los Angeles

3-7:30 p.m.

Neon Viewing Party

Sunset Tower Hotel, West Hollywood

Governors Ball

The Academy’s official after-party. Menu by Wolfgang Puck Catering with drinks by Tequila Don Julio, Clarendelle & Domaine Clarence Dillon wines and Champagne Lallier.

Ray Dolby Ballroom at Ovation Hollywood, Hollywood

Immediately following the Oscars broadcast

Searchlight Pictures

Celebrating nominees from “A Complete Unknown and “A Real Pain.”

Cipriani, Beverly Hills

7:30 p.m.

Vanity Fair

Hosted by VF editor-in-chief Radhika Jones. Music by DJ Tay James and DJ Politik in the Tequila Don Julio Music Room.

Wallis Annenberg Center for the Performing Arts, Beverly Hills

8 p.m.

Netflix

Chateau Marmont, West Hollywood

Immediately after the Oscar ceremony.

The Party

Madonna and Guy Oseary host their 17th annual soirée. Sponsored by Gucci, Capital One and Salesforce. Specialty drinks by Starbucks.

Private residence

10 p.m.

Gold Party

VIP late-night after-party hosted by Jay-Z and Beyoncé.

Chateau Marmont, West Hollywood

11 p.m.
